guidelines.title: Appointment Policies
bookingFeeList: A booking fee of â‚¹200 per person is required to prioritize serious clients, plan slots, and begin sterilization.
The booking fee will be adjusted against the final amount.
This fee is non-refundable for no-shows or cancellations made less than 12 hours before the appointment.
durationList: Please arrive within the first 30 minutes. Late arrivals may result in cancellation.
If you arrive beyond the allotted slot, you will need to rebook.

numberedPoints.title: Hygiene and Preparation
content: Thorough Cleaning: The area to be pierced must be cleaned prior to arrival.
Avoidance of Irritants: Do not apply makeup, lotions, or perfumes to the site.
Grooming: Perform grooming at least 2 days prior.

numberedPoints.title: Health and Safety
content: Pre-Piercing Research: Understand that a piercing is an open wound.
Pregnancy: Do not get pierced if you are pregnant.

numberedPoints.title: Anatomical Assessment
content: Certain piercings require an anatomical assessment via photos.

numberedPoints.title: Substance Restrictions
content: Do not consume alcohol or drugs 12 hours before or after your appointment.

numberedPoints.title: Medical Intervention
content: Severe complications may require professional medical advice.

numberedPoints.title: Hygiene Protocols
content: I adhere to strict hygiene and safety protocols.

numberedPoints.title: Piercing Limitations
content: Maximum of 3 piercings per sitting. Wait 2 months before piercing the second ear cartilage.

numberedPoints.title: Jewelry
content: Basic implant-grade jewelry is provided. Initial jewelry must not be removed for 2 months.

numberedPoints.title: Aftercare Commitment
content: Proper aftercare is your sole responsibility. Healing takes time.

numberedPoints.title: Gallery Contribution
content: Provide clear photos of your healing piercing for the gallery.

numberedPoints.title: Travel and Lifestyle
content: Avoid pools or beaches for 1 month after piercing.

numberedPoints.title: Piercer Fallibility
content: If a piercing is placed incorrectly, I may offer to re-pierce the area.

aftercare.title: General Tips for Piercing Care
generalTips: Clean your piercings 1-2 times a day with saline solution. Avoid over-cleaning.
Don't touch, twist, or play with your piercings. Follow LITHA (Leave It The Hell Alone).
Don't touch your piercings with dirty hands. Wash your hands prior to touching.
Keep your piercings dry. After cleaning/bathing, gently dry your piercings.
Do not sleep on your piercing or cause trauma (hitting, snagging, or pressure).
Pain, irritation, redness, and swelling are expected in the initial stages.
Apply a warm or cold compress (if required) for swollen piercings.
Do not change jewelry for the first 2 months unless absolutely necessary.
Sleep on a clean pillow or place a clean cloth over it.
Avoid applying ointments, betadine, or alcohol to your piercings.
Avoid harsh chemicals (soap, shampoo, makeup) around the site for a few days.
Avoid sour and spicy food for the first few days.
Avoid pools, beaches, and public water bodies for a month.
Keep your piercings at a safe distance from pets.
Contact your piercer or a doctor for serious complications.
navelTips: Avoid tight clothing or high-waisted pants that can rub against the piercing.
Avoid rigorous abdominal exercises for a few weeks.
oralTips: Use mouthwash instead of brushing directly over the site.
Carry saline solution to rinse after every meal.
Avoid alcohol for a few weeks.
Avoid kissing and oral sex during the initial healing phase.
